intro: Nonatelia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy texture. Nonatelia grandiflora is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks.
